definition: to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)

sentences.chinese: 金碧辉煌的宫殿使她赞叹不已。

sentences.english: The beautiful silks and velvets surprised him very much.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的丝绸及天鹅绒令他赞叹不已。

sentences.english: Her handling of the crisis fills me _with__admiration_.
sentences.chinese: 她对这一危机的处理使我赞叹不已。

sentences.english: Inside "Buddha Chuan mural, " What is even more amazed.
sentences.chinese: 殿内“佛传壁画”，更令人赞叹不已。

sentences.english: It was just one glance, but its beauty stole my breath away.
sentences.chinese: 我只不过瞥了一眼，但是它的美却令我赞叹不已。

sentences.english: Palau is noteworthy for its amazing and scuba diving sights.
sentences.chinese: 帛琉以其令人赞叹的浮潜和潜水景点著称。

sentences.english: You steal my heart, and you take my breath away.
sentences.chinese: 你偷我的心，你把我屏息赞叹。

sentences.english: This is the sagacity that how your person highly praises and clement.
sentences.chinese: 这是多么令人赞叹的聪敏与宽厚。

sentences.english: However, we never praise cults for they encourage people to commit wrongdoings.
sentences.chinese: 如果是叫人造罪业堕三途的邪教，我们绝对不赞叹。

sentences.english: Outside I seem unable to stop sighing, the kind of exhalation normally associated with being in love.
sentences.chinese: 在外面我不禁赞叹，这是一种与爱有关的叹息。

sentences.english: Wie could be the achievement is still worthy of the praise.
sentences.chinese: 可魏圣美的成绩仍然是值得赞叹的。

sentences.english: Looking at the night sky, bright stars who don't admire infinite universe?
sentences.chinese: 遥望星光灿烂的夜空，谁不赞叹宇宙的无穷？

sentences.english: We all admire her for her free-flowing movement.
sentences.chinese: 我们对她流畅的动作赞叹不已。

sentences.english: He dazzled the crowd with his oratory skills.
sentences.chinese: 他以演讲术使听众赞叹不已。

sentences.english: "People than yellow flower thin" li qingzhao, bumpy life let a person gasp in admiration.
sentences.chinese: “人比黄花瘦”李清照，坎坷的人生让人赞叹。

sentences.english: Only from afar can the height of its source be admired.
sentences.chinese: 唯有居远遥望才能赞叹其源头之高。

definition: to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to sigh with sorrow, regret etc/rueful/deeply moved
to admire/to look up to/to respect sb greatly
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
